definition: to wish for/to desire/variant of 慾|欲[yu4]

sentences.english: The abode of celibacy is attained through this plan.
sentences.chinese: 禁欲可以通过这样的方式达到。

sentences.english: The concept of celibacy carries connotations of asceticism and religious fervor .
sentences.chinese: 修道者的独身观念含有禁欲与宗教热情之意。

sentences.english: The character of this asceticism is determined by its motive.
sentences.chinese: 的性质，这禁欲主义是取决于它的动机。

sentences.english: The Stoics developed three eidetic reductions of future misfortune.
sentences.chinese: 禁欲学派对于预测灾难发展三个心象的推论。

sentences.english: To seek to extinguish anger utterly, is but a bravery of the stoics.
sentences.chinese: 企图完全压制住愤怒只不过是禁欲者的勇敢表现之一。

sentences.english: Many cerebral narcissists are celibate even when married.
sentences.chinese: 许多大脑自恋者甚至在他们结婚后还会保持禁欲状态。

sentences.english: Between asceticism and indulgence men and races swing.
sentences.chinese: 人们及各种族总是在禁欲主义和放荡形骸之间徘徊。

sentences.english: As a methodist he was a fervent advocate of temperance .
sentences.chinese: 身为一名卫理公会教徒，他是禁欲的热情拥护者。

sentences.english: The capability of sustaining the life force in the body is celibacy .
sentences.chinese: 禁欲是一种存在于人体的持续的生命力量。

sentences.english: He practiced a Middle Way between self-mortification and self- indulgence.
sentences.chinese: 他实践了在自我禁欲与自我纵欲之间的中道。

sentences.english: Fasting is an act of  homage to the majesty of appetite.
sentences.chinese: 禁欲乃是为了尊重欲望之庄严。

sentences.english: I know the pleasures of asceticism, and the sense of power it gives.
sentences.chinese: 我知道禁欲主义的快乐，以及它所赋予的力量感。

sentences.english: This is basically some form of asceticism, the control of the body.
sentences.chinese: 可以说是某种禁欲主义，克制肉体。

sentences.english: Paul and the good guys are all ascetic.
sentences.chinese: 保罗和所有好人都是禁欲的。

sentences.english: The early settlers believed in Calvinist restraint.
sentences.chinese: 早期的美国移民是卡尔文式禁欲主义的信民。

definition: euphemism for sexual intercourse/to go to bed with sb
